alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR TUSAYAN AND THE GRAND CANYON IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM MST... At 1237 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Tusayan, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maricopa Point At Grand Canyon, Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Hermit`s Rest At Grand Canyon, Tusayan, Shoshone Point At Grand Canyon, Grandview Point At Grand Canyon, Pima Point At Grand Canyon, South Rim Visitors Center, Hopi Point At Grand Canyon, Grand Canyon Village, and Ten-X Campground. This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 228 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
